result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Reece White

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Phillip Reece White in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Phillip Reece White.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Count 1 in 22CF53 and Counts 1 and 2 in 20CM4. 22CM36 would be dismissed but read in along with remaining counts in 20CM4. Count 2 in 22CF53 is dismissed. For 22CF53, for Count 1 - Withheld probation for 3 years probation. No credit. Conditions of probation include 910.78 in restitution, comply with programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs. In 20CM4, for Count 1 - 100 days jail with credit for 75 days, time served and pay mandatory court costs. For Count 2 - 100 days jail with credit for 75 days, time served. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 in 22CF53 and Counts 1 and 2 in 20CM4. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for 22CF53 for Count 1 - Withheld probation for 3 years probation. No credit. Conditions of probation include $910.78 in restitution, comply with programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs, no contact with Walmart and Kwik Trips in Superior. In 20CM4, for Count 1 - 100 days jail with credit for 75 days, time served, concurrent to Count 1 and pay mandatory court costs. For Count 2 - 100 days jail with credit for 75 days, time served.

10:14 AM Defendant Phillip Reece White in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Phillip Reece White.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Have had communications regarding offer. Rosenthal indicates close to resolution. Needs more time.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

9:33 AM Defendant Phillip Reece White in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Phillip Reece White.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Receipts copy of complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. Rosenthal asks for more time.  Status set.
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM Calling cases 22cf53, 22cm36, 20cm4. Prelim and stc. Defendant Phillip White in court, in custody with attorney Joseph Rosenthal.  ADA Peter Kruger appears for the State of Wisconsin  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Misdemeanor cases to be set for STC. Felony case for arraignment.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
03:16 PM Defendant Phillip Reece White in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Phillip Reece White in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Phillip Reece White appeared by video means with Attorney. Court calls this case and 20CM4 and 22CM36; Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint(s), waives reading. Address is correct on the new complaints; Request preliminary hearing on the felony matter; request status conference on the other files; warrant is quashed based on appearance; 
Atty Hoffman-bond posted 1-6-20; defendant indicated he was incarcerated; was released in Feb or March ?? 
State-in 22CF53 state request 3500.00-no contct with Walmart; 20CM4-2000.00 cash and no contact with Kwik Trip; 20CM36-2000.00 cash and no contact with Walmart; 18 failures to appear in MN; multiple cases with multiple failures to appear
Atty Hoffman-primary residence is in Duluth; no significant ties to Douglas County; defendant is on probation; no money to post (maybe 300.00 to 400.00)
Court-20CM4-court orders 1000.00 cash; 22CM36-court orders 750.00 cash; 22CF53-court orders 1500.00 cash bail; No contact with Walmart and No contact with Kwik Trip  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
